Specify \"para la parrilla\" (for grilling) or \"para la plancha\" (for pan)."]}]}]]}],["$","div",null,{"className":"bg-white rounded-2xl p-8 shadow-sm border border-rose-100","children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"text-xl font-bold text-gray-900 mb-4","children":"Asado at Home"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-600 mb-4","children":"If you have a balcony, you can have a parrilla (grill). Weekend asados are the best way to make Argentine friends."}],["$","div",null,{"className":"bg-rose-50 rounded-lg p-4","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-sm text-rose-800","children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"Basics:"}]," Carbon (charcoal) from the supermarket, starter cubes, chimichurri (make your own or buy), coarse salt. Cook slow over indirect heat. Expect 2-3 hours for the full experience."]}]}]]}]]}],["$","div",null,{"className":"mt-8 bg-white rounded-2xl p-8 shadow-sm border border-rose-100","children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"text-xl font-bold text-gray-900 mb-4","children":"Argentine Recipes to Learn"}],["$","div",null,{"className":"grid md:grid-cols-3 gap-6","children":[["$","div",null,{"children":[["$","h4",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-gray-900 mb-2","children":"Chimichurri"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-sm text-gray-600","children":"Parsley, oregano, garlic, vinegar, oil, red pepper flakes. The essential asado sauce. Make a big jarâ€”it keeps for weeks."}]]}],["$","div",null,{"children":[["$","h4",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-gray-900 mb-2","children":"Tortilla de Papas"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-sm text-gray-600","children":"Spanish-style potato omelet. Slice potatoes thin, fry gently, mix with eggs, cook until set. Perfect any time of day."}]]}],["$","div",null,{"children":[["$","h4",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-gray-900 mb-2","children":"Milanesa"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-sm text-gray-600","children":"Pound meat thin, dip in egg, coat in breadcrumbs, fry until golden. Serve with lemon. Comfort food at its finest."}]]}]]}]]}]]}]
